author: Q U A S A R
title: EmancipationStation
description: Catalyst lacks the ability to capture the story of our decentralized lives and allow us to organize ourselves to prepare for the unknown fut

assessments.note: The proposer highlights experience in the field and a working group. More clarity in defining or detailing and example of what can be developed differently from the exciting platform in "ideascale". What the alternative apps or tools can be used to improve the project catalyst and examples of applications that could be added to it.

The challenge brief is very specific: "Quality Dapps and integrations will increase utility & adoption of Cardano." The proposal to me seems to be too ephemeral and has a philosophical slant that does not directly tackle the problem at hand - creating Dapps and integrations. The proposer states his solution to the problem: "The dapps will be an aggregation of all dapps and software that is brought forth in the past, current, and future proposals." This does not seem like a solution to me, more of a position statement.
Not a specific plan to do what the project mention just a general pick with the distribution of funds rounds.
The idea is very vague as it is not part of the challenge.
It raised a general topic but the problem is too board. It looks like a very ambitious and challenging proposal. It didn't further demonstrate the problem.

I can agree with general elements of this proposal but I don't think it does a great job of formalizing of what the vision actually is. Namely - how do we get there and how it all ties together. It still seems very conceptual at this stage. Unsure about the inclusion of wallet and asking for ada either - that's somewhat odd.
This can't be called a proposal, just a vague idea that is hard to grasp.
Requires more clear objectives, examples of applications that can improve over the current platform and how the funds will be used into the development of such solution.
The proposer does not list specific experience in Dapp development, while the plan is too generic and has no budget breakdown. It seems unlikely this proposal will be implemented successfully
The person that want to move the project has experience but as i mention before no real plan.
There no clear plan presented in the solution
It didn't explain clearly about its experience and background of team.

Knowing this member as very active within the community - it would be great to highlight the relevant experiences so that we can rally behind this effort. Would there be a team in place to help carry this out? Unsure what is behind the scenes. Which brings me to the second point - there is one grand figure of budget listed. But it has no indication beyond that what it really tries to accomplish. Sensible break down would be really useful as that could shed some light of what is ahead of us and what we'll need. So it is a bit miss for me - hoping to see this reworked so we can look at it with greater finesse in later rounds.
No plan is presented, it's also not clear what experience the proposer has. The proposer asks for funds to "support" this proposal which is inappropriate

I agree there are changes that could bring a more user friendly experience in the project catalyst should it emancipate from ideascale and into a fully fledged website dedicated to the project where education and applications deliver more easier format in regards of its navigation. But the project lack more information how it can reach that goal.
I do not think that it does provide sufficient information on its feasibility and how effectively it addresses the challenge. The proposal seems incomplete.
No real plan, just an idea.So nope.
The proposal doesn't provide any details of project implementation, skills and experience required for implementation.

There is no roadmap or milestones to specify step by step plan. The objective is too board and it didn't explain how to assess success.
There is no breakdown or clear demonstration to explain how the 25000USD funding will be used.

This proposal still reads more like a philosophical concept as an actual proposal that we can act upon. Having said that - that's why it misses elements like roadmap or milestones that we could aspire to on the road to this emancipationstation of sorts. I would also like to learn more about other things like - how does success look like? What challenges does author anticipate as we navigate this idea/proposal. Any risks? I think a lot more effort needs to go into something that we could invest in. Perhaps a bit more information in depth and maybe int he later funding rounds?
No roadmap for implementation, no KPI's, no budget breakdown for the 25k requested

solution: The dapps will be an aggregation of all dapps and software that is brought forth in the past, current, and future proposals.
experience: Independent Scholar, caged human, systems migration and idea landscape architect.
